issue.body:
See https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/pull/142876.

For a week of testing, an annoying pop-up did not appear for me, while when I tried to rate something on my own, a pop-up always appeared.

comment.body: @Alex-302 например, если сериал сейчас в эфире (в онгоинге, то есть серии выходят раз в неделю), то заходишь на страницу с сериалом каждую неделю, чтобы посмотреть оценку новой серии.

issue.title: CNet/RedVenture properties now advertorial?!
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

According to [reporting](https://www.theverge.com/2023/2/2/23582046/cnet-red-ventures-ai-seo-advertisers-changed-reviews-editorial-independence-affiliate-marketing), CNet & other [RedVenture properties](https://www.redventures.com/about/brands#logoGrid) are being turned into advertorial sites via [biased AI](https://www.theverge.com/2023/1/19/23562966/cnet-ai-written-stories-red-ventures-seo-marketing) & corporate pressure.

### Proposed solution

To be determined?   I wanted to bring up the info to let the AG team decide what to do.

### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body: Ok, but what's the right approach for an ad blocker on such advertorial sites?

comment.body:
> После резкого закрытия браузера реклама появилась. До того как браузер закрылся рекламы не было

Это из-за того, что яндекс браузер препятствует работе расширений-блокировщиков. Используйте полноценный Хром или установите программу для вашей ОС.

issue.title: CNet/RedVenture properties now advertorial?!
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

According to [reporting](https://www.theverge.com/2023/2/2/23582046/cnet-red-ventures-ai-seo-advertisers-changed-reviews-editorial-independence-affiliate-marketing), CNet & other [RedVenture properties](https://www.redventures.com/about/brands#logoGrid) are being turned into advertorial sites via [biased AI](https://www.theverge.com/2023/1/19/23562966/cnet-ai-written-stories-red-ventures-seo-marketing) & corporate pressure.

### Proposed solution

To be determined?   I wanted to bring up the info to let the AG team decide what to do.

### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body: @TPS Most of reviews are ads (Brand representatives often provide items for reviews). Paid reviews is not a reason to block whole sites.

pull_request.title: fullhdfilmizle5.net
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

`https://fullhdfilmizle5.net/`

<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/103899764/221882512-632f35b8-9baa-4499-b474-c6ec62a7fc14.png)


</details>

### Add your comment and screenshots

1 - renamed `fullhdfilmizle5.com` to `fullhdfilmizle5.net` 

2 - `fullhdfilmizle.cc` removed because it redirects to `fullhdfilmizle5.net`

3- This update blocks all ads on the website, but no checks for dead rules.

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

comment.body:
Do zablokowania tych reklam konieczne jest włączenie zaawansowanej ochrony (`Advanced protection`), ale w tym przypadku i tak czasami reklamy nadal mogą się pojawiać.

Niestety blokery reklam na iOS (to samo dotyczy rozszerzeń do przeglądarki Safari) mają ograniczone możliwości, część reguł nie jest w ogóle obsługiwana, część może być wykonana zbyt późno i przez to wyskakujące okienka/reklamy na niektórych stronach czasami nie są blokowane.

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: Threema Web and App (all messengers)
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Since an update from Adguard, Threema Web or the app no longer runs on a Windows computer. Even if I deactivate Adguard. I have to take the DNS in the Fritzbox away from Adguard, delete the DNS cache on the Windows machine and restart. Then Threema gets a connection again.

### Proposed solution

I have not yet been able to narrow down the problem.
In general, I would find it helpful if messengers were excluded from Adguard when filtering.

### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body: @Liftboy222 Hi. Please describe how to reproduce a problem.

review.body:
* Please revert all `#%#` JS rules (non-scriptlets). After change, that rules will stop work in Firefox extension.

* New domains for `#` rules must be added at the beginning of the domains list (you can leave as is for this time).

pull_request.title: Added coverage for the Tor domains of Reddit, Twitter, and Facebook
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [ ] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [x] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

Coverage of major social medias' Tor addresses had not been universally applied in Base Filter and Popups Filter, primarily in the case of Reddit whose Tor address is the newest created.

### Enter the issue address

N/A

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

1. Your comment

Although the `[$` syntax was new to me, I went through the 3 most important files in the repo to modify their existing entries to cover the Tor addresses.

2. Screenshots

<details><summary>Reddit Onion site ad currently not blocked by big adblocker lists:</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22780683/221485786-ea2f8d57-7464-4662-8628-3dd414901c9f.png)

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

Incorrect rule.
Correct - with one modifier:

```adblock
[$path=/marketplace/]facebook.com,facebookwkhpilnemxj7asaniu7vnjjbiltxjqhye3mhbshg7kx5tfyd.onion#$?#div[class][style^="max-width:"]:has(> span > div  a[href^="/ads/about/"]) { display: none !important; }
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8361299/222120711-e5e71c1f-730a-4db9-883b-a25a19b55e6d.png)

review.body:
* Please revert all `#%#` JS rules (non-scriptlets). After change, that rules will stop work in Firefox extension.

* New domains for `#` rules must be added at the beginning of the domains list (you can leave as is for this time).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: Lisa ai (appsflyer)
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

4.0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed analytics or tracker

### Which browser(s) do you use?

the problem is with app, not a site

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.inspire.ai

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Social Media filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Widgets filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, AdGuard DNS filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

|| *-settings.appsflyersdk.com^

issue.title: Threema Web and App (all messengers)
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Since an update from Adguard, Threema Web or the app no longer runs on a Windows computer. Even if I deactivate Adguard. I have to take the DNS in the Fritzbox away from Adguard, delete the DNS cache on the Windows machine and restart. Then Threema gets a connection again.

### Proposed solution

I have not yet been able to narrow down the problem.
In general, I would find it helpful if messengers were excluded from Adguard when filtering.

### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body:
If I include adguard as a DNS server in the router and set the Ip for the DNS server accordingly, then Threema Web fails on all machines in the network. 

I have always deleted the DNS cache in Wodows and restarted the computer. Then I tried Threema Web a few times. Threema Web can't find a connection with Adgourd deactivated or active. Only when I set the DNS in the router (Fritzbox) to a classic one does Threema Web work.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock Origin 1.47.0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.leboncoin.fr/annonces/offres

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, AdGuard Chinese filter, AdGuard French filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Social Media filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter, EasyList, EasyList Germany, EasyPrivacy, ABPVN List, List-KR, EasyList Cookie List, Legitimate URL Shortener

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

Ads are blocked in the search page, but the ad container is still showed.

![Screenshot from 2023-02-21 18-56-36](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48565914/220424170-fa785755-e070-4bc9-a96b-983740fe576f.png)


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
Sorry to bother you once again: the fix does not work for categories with tiles organised side-by-side.

There are also blank spaces where sponsored links are supposed to be (I imagine that's unavoidable).

It affects the following categories:
https://www.leboncoin.fr/_maison_/offres
https://www.leboncoin.fr/_mode_/offres
https://www.leboncoin.fr/_loisirs_/offres
https://www.leboncoin.fr/_animaux_/offres
https://www.leboncoin.fr/autres/offres

Screenshot of a visible container + two blank spaces where sponsored links are supposed to be:
![Screenshot from 2023-03-01 17-50-14](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48565914/222207451-4eb5eab2-0a54-465f-a0af-27e46e644e4f.png)

comment.body:
It looks like it's part of the functionality of the site.  Please add this rule to the user rules:
`dat.com##body > iframe[title*="Analytics"][style^="position: fixed;"]`

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: Added coverage for the Tor domains of Reddit, Twitter, and Facebook

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [ ] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [x] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

Coverage of major social medias' Tor addresses had not been universally applied in Base Filter and Popups Filter, primarily in the case of Reddit whose Tor address is the newest created.

### Enter the issue address

N/A

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

1. Your comment

Although the `[$` syntax was new to me, I went through the 3 most important files in the repo to modify their existing entries to cover the Tor addresses.

2. Screenshots

<details><summary>Reddit Onion site ad currently not blocked by big adblocker lists:</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22780683/221485786-ea2f8d57-7464-4662-8628-3dd414901c9f.png)

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

comment.body: Thanks for the clarifications. I'll see to which extent I can implement them overnight.
